item.title: Rooting for American power is the best option in this dangerous world
item.description: The nation must maintain political, economic and cultural edge over its competitors.

item.title: The bitter politics of land is roaring back to life
item.description: Henry George shows why rent control and taxes won’t solve nation’s land crisis.

item.title: Biden and Trump, in their own ways, poisoned the immigration debate
item.description: Even now, when the need is urgent, neither political party will seize the moment for immigration reform.

item.title: Wes Moore embarrasses Maryland with his gerrymandering ploy
item.description: The Democratic leader of the state Senate deserves praise for resisting pressure from the governor.

item.title: Put the Mona Lisa in its own building — for its sake and the visitors’
item.description: What might be the world’s most famous painting needs to be easy to see and hard to steal.

item.title: Nigeria’s crisis runs deeper than just a war on Christians
item.description: The Trump administration is dangerously misreading the conflict and its causes.

item.title: Yes, colleges face a crisis. It’s also an opportunity.
item.description: Over two centuries, American higher education has periodically remade itself. Time to do it again.

item.title: How long does covid booster protection last? A new study offers answers.
item.description: More evidence highlighting the benefit, and limitations, of covid-19 vaccines

item.title: Outside New York, democratic socialism lost
item.description: A big win for property rights on a small island, and a liberal enclave rejects tax hikes.

item.title: The science that extended Dick Cheney’s life was a choice
item.description: The biomedical research engine will create more breakthroughs — if we keep it up and running.

item.title: Meta’s misappropriation of PG-13 threatens a trusted system
item.description: Conflating social media content and movies is thoroughly misleading.

item.title: How Tucker Carlson instigated an inevitable war within MAGA

item.title: The filibuster is a wall against a Mamdani-inspired socialist dystopia
item.description: Imagine what today’s Democratic Party would do if it gained unchecked power?

item.description: Most of the justices seem to understand there is no distinction between tariffs and taxes.

item.title: Be afraid, Republicans. Be very afraid.
item.description: Democrats don’t agree on their message or who should deliver it. They won everywhere anyway.

item.title: Have food prices changed since Trump’s inauguration? We are tracking it.
item.description: In partnership with Numerator, we’re tracking inflation over more than 30 essential ingredients for your daily food consumption.
